Package net.parallaxed.bluejam

Interface Summary
Function This interface defines the behaviours of a GP function.
Heuristic A heuristic is any class that can provide a pattern template upon which a terminal set can evolve.
NoteSequence NoteSequence is the interface describing operations that can be performed over a sequence of Notes.
Terminal All terminals must have unique identifiers to satisfy uniqueness in a TerminalSet.
 

Class Summary
Evolve The evolve class carries out the main evolution cycles and outputs "winning" musical candidates by notifying listeners.
EvolveHeuristic TODO Implement this.
HeuristicCollection Provides a class to store population heuristics and select them using different modes/distributions.
Individual This class defines an individual.
IndividualParameters If the individual desires different parameters from those defined in the population by default, it can override the population's decision by creating a class of IndividualParameters.
JamParamters The ParameterCollection class is used by BlueJam to specify the properties of a cycle of evolution.
Mutable Utility Class defining which properties of a note can be changed.
Note This class is currently under consideration for the "abstract" modifier.
NoteCollection Simply contains a list of notes in their order of play.
NoteLeaf Implements a unary note-sequence (only one note in the sequence) NoteLeaf instances extend the functionality of Note, such that it can be added and manipulated within a NoteTree.
NoteLeafSet The note set of all possible pitch classes in the octave range supplied to the constructor.
NoteTree Note trees are a data structure representing an unordered tree of NoteSequences, itself forming a note sequence.
Population The population class holds a collection of individuals and evolves them with or without a set of heuristics.
PopulationParameters Provides a moderately strongly typed parameter collection for the population properties and constants.
Scale This Enum describes how to produce each scale using stepped jumps over pitch classes.
Scale.BLUES Defines a blues scale with hexatonic pitch representation.
Scale.MAJOR Defines a standard major scale.
Scale.MINOR Defines a standard minor scale.
ScaledSet Given a set of rules for the scale, ScaledSet can work out the set of notes that fit that scale, over a given number of octaves.
SequenceParameters Currently, custom tree parameters aren't supported, so this default instantiation should cover the basics.
TerminalSet Wraps an ArrayList to provide set-like functionality (one unique instance per set).
TreeParser This class reads in information from passed tree files, which normally represent a serialized layout of a NoteSequence.
 

Enum Summary
Accidental Defines the possible accidentals.
HeuristicCollection.SELECTION_TYPE This Enum provides defines the possible methods by which heuristics are selected from the collection
JamParamters.Config Defines the typed configuration values in a ParameterCollection
Pitch This enumeration represents the pitches and can be used to determine enharmonic equivalence between pitch classes.
Rhythm This Enum contains all the rhythm's BlueJam supports.
